name: Morbid Catastrophe
description:
For years, I have been having a nightmare where I see the world dying from my window. As I contemplate the catastrophe, I see myself. It is a strange sensation that I have never been able to explain in words. This is where Morbid Catastrophe was born - a game based on a recurring nightmare.

A experience of catastrophic horror.


Morbid Catastrophe is a first and third person game in which you play as a newly divorced man facing a catastrophe due to a failed experiment.

  • Solve the puzzles by switching between the real world and the underground laboratory.

  • Alternate the cards you equip to change the map.

  • Escape from the creature to get everything back to normal.

Synopsis



After settling into his new home, a man watches as the sky breaks and the world changes. An unprecedented catastrophic event is witnessed from his window. There is something strange in the atmosphere, something changing drastically and in a morbid way.

Day 100 after the catastrophe: Our protagonist does not feel hungry or thirsty. His thoughts are particularly focused on this. Even after so many days, this feeling is still strange - not having the ability to die of starvation. He does not sleep and is never tired. He is simply still alive without any means of entertainment nearby.

Day 185: The TV picks up the signal of an antenna - is there a survivor of the catastrophe? There are dangers outside the safe place. But what is left when all there is, is nothing?



Change, move on and escape from the creature to reverse the catastrophe.
